data.lyric:
[ti:What Makes You Country]
[ar:Luke Bryan]
[al:What Makes You Country]
[by:]
[offset:0]
[00:00.00]What Makes You Country - Luke Bryan
[00:14.96]Written by：Luke Bryan/Dallas Davidson/Ashley Gorley
[00:29.92]People talkin' 'bout what is and what ain't country
[00:33.20]
[00:35.47]What gives 'em a right to wear a pair of beat up boots
[00:38.98]
[00:41.06]Is it the size of your tires and your fires or your wild a** buddies
[00:45.46]
[00:47.54]Well give me a minute let me hit you with some hometown truth
[00:51.41]
[00:52.84]You could be a cowboy on the Texas plain
[00:56.49]Or a plowboy waitin' on the rain
[00:59.37]We're all a little different but we're all the same
[01:02.24]Everybody doin' their own thing
[01:04.72]I got my dirt road cred when I was 12
[01:08.30]On a no cap tractor halling in bales
[01:11.54]Backing in boats fishing landlines
[01:14.61]Running bird docks through the Georgia pines
[01:17.17]Step side cover down in peanut dust
[01:20.21]Friday night spotlight that was us
[01:23.14]It might not've been you but I ain't judging
[01:26.42]Just be proud of what makes you country
[01:30.49]
[01:41.51]Does it run in your blood
[01:42.97]Did it come from your daddy and mama
[01:44.92]
[01:47.29]Where you converted by an Alabama song on the radio
[01:50.71]
[01:51.26]That feels so right
[01:52.44]
[01:53.34]Did you lock eyes with a little green eyed girl from Jackson
[01:56.98]
[01:59.36]Tell me what got ya I just gotta know
[02:03.03]
[02:04.11]Me I got my Sunday learning in a level church
[02:08.50]Silver cream corn in a backyard dirt
[02:11.26]Waiting for the fall to finally come along
[02:14.30]So I can grab my gun and get my outside on
[02:17.50]Step side cover down in peanut dust
[02:20.17]Friday night spotlight that was us
[02:23.36]It might not've been you but I ain't judging
[02:26.32]Just be proud of what makes you country
[02:30.37]
[02:41.48]Might be from a city or a little farm town
[02:44.46]Whatever kind of square that you drove around
[02:47.32]Do you wear in on your sleeve or keep it deep down
[02:50.19]You know you gotta let it out
[02:52.38]I got my dirt road cred back when I was 12
[02:56.12]On a no cap tractor haling in bales
[02:59.26]Backing in boats fishing land lines
[03:02.44]Running bird docks through them Georgia pines
[03:05.12]Step side cover down in peanut dust
[03:08.24]Friday night spotlight that was us
[03:11.14]It might not've been you but I ain't judging
[03:14.16]And just be proud of what makes you country
[03:18.60]
[03:22.75]Whatever makes you country
[03:24.53]
[03:30.16]You do your kinda country
[03:32.36]
[03:33.19]They doing they kind of country
[03:35.35]
[03:36.07]I do my kind of country
[03:38.64]
[03:40.38]Whatever makes us country
data.trans:
[ti:What Makes You Country]
[ar:Luke Bryan]
[al:What Makes You Country]
[by:]
[offset:0]
[00:00.00]//
[00:14.96]//
[00:29.92]人们总在谈论到底什么才是国家
[00:33.20]
[00:35.47]难道是国家让他们穿着破靴子吗
[00:38.98]
[00:41.06]难道是国家让你过这样的生活 交这样的朋友吗
[00:45.46]
[00:47.54]给我一分钟 让我告诉你真相
[00:51.41]
[00:52.84]你可以做德克萨斯平原上的牛仔
[00:56.49]或是一辈子等着下雨的农民
[00:59.37]我们都有些不同 但我们又都一样
[01:02.24]每个人都在努力做着自己的事
[01:04.72]我十二岁时就开始了艰苦之路
[01:08.30]开着拖拉机拉着成捆的稻草
[01:11.54]坐船出门 下网捕鱼
[01:14.61]在松树林中追逐猎犬
[01:17.17]皮卡车上总是蒙着尘土
[01:20.21]周五晚上去足球场踢球
[01:23.14]也许你的生活并非如此 我也无法判断
[01:26.42]请为你的国家自豪吧
[01:30.49]
[01:41.51]你的血液是否还在沸腾
[01:42.97]这一切是否来自你的父母
[01:44.92]
[01:47.29]收音机里响起了阿拉巴马的歌曲
[01:50.71]
[01:51.26]这感觉多么美妙
[01:52.44]
[01:53.34]你是否盯着杰克逊身旁的绿眼睛女孩
[01:56.98]
[01:59.36]告诉我你怎么了 我必须知道
[02:03.03]
[02:04.11]星期天我在教堂里做礼拜
[02:08.50]后院的甜玉米长势喜人
[02:11.26]静静等待着秋天的到来
[02:14.30]我要戴上猎枪 出门打猎
[02:17.50]皮卡车上总是蒙着尘土
[02:20.17]周五晚上去足球场踢球
[02:23.36]也许你的生活并非如此 我也无法判断
[02:26.32]请为你的国家自豪吧
[02:30.37]
[02:41.48]也许你来自城市或是小村庄
[02:44.46]无论你生活在什么样的地方
[02:47.32]你会把热情释放出来还是深藏心底
[02:50.19]你知道你必须表达出你的爱
[02:52.38]我十二岁时就开始了艰苦之路
[02:56.12]开着拖拉机拉着成捆的稻草
[02:59.26]坐船出门 下网捕鱼
[03:02.44]在松树林中追逐猎犬
[03:05.12]皮卡车上总是蒙着尘土
[03:08.24]周五晚上去足球场踢球
[03:11.14]也许你的生活并非如此 我也无法判断
[03:14.16]请为你的国家自豪吧
[03:18.60]
[03:22.75]无论你来自哪里
[03:24.53]
[03:30.16]你为你的国家自豪
[03:32.36]
[03:33.19]他们为他们的国家骄傲
[03:35.35]
[03:36.07]我为我的国家自豪
[03:38.64]
[03:40.38]无论我们来自哪里
